intro: Bupleurum gerardi var. szovitsianum, commonly known as the Szovits' goat's beard, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and pinnately compound leaves. Its small white to pale yellow flowers appear in early summer, and the plant is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. It is valued in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and hepatoprotective properties.
